data.title: Scene In Nevada: Top Gun
data.meta_description: Did you know that the film Top Gun, starring Tom Cruise, was partially filmed in Nevada? Find out where!
data.text:
The 1986 American film Top Gun is about a young pilot at the United States Navy’s elite fighter weapons school who competes to become the best in the class.

Tom Cruise stars in this action drama alongside Kelly McGillis, Val Kilmer, Anthony Edwards, Tom Skerritt, Tim Robbins, and Meg Ryan. Watch the official trailer below:

Top Gun was such a hit when it was released that it became the highest grossing film of 1986 and has made many “top film” lists over the years. In 2015, the United States Library of Congress selected Top Gun for preservation in the National Film Registry, finding it “culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant.”

Top Gun was partially filmed in Nevada at the Naval Air Station in Fallon. The NAS Fallon is the United States Navy’s premier air-to-air and air-to-ground training facility.

Most of the aerial sequences were shot at NAS Fallon. Ground-mounted cameras provided shots of the aircraft maneuvering over land.

Air-to-air shots were filmed using a Learjet with camera pods pointed towards either the front or the rear of the aircraft.
